title: PTO Policy
content: Employees are entitled to 20 days of paid time off per year. PTO accrues monthly at a rate of 1.67 days. Unused PTO can be carried over up to a maximum of 5 days into the next calendar year. Requests must be submitted at least 2 weeks in advance through the HR portal.

title: Remote Work Guidelines
content: All employees may work remotely up to 3 days per week. Remote work days must be coordinated with your team lead. A stable internet connection of at least 50 Mbps is required. Employees must be available during core hours (10 AM to 4 PM local time).

title: Expense Reimbursement
content: Business expenses must be submitted within 30 days of the transaction. Receipts are required for all expenses over $25. Travel expenses are reimbursed at the standard GSA per diem rates. Approval is required from your direct manager before incurring expenses over $500.

title: Onboarding Checklist
content: New hires must complete the following within their first week: security training, IT setup, HR paperwork, team introduction meeting, and access provisioning. The buddy system pairs each new hire with a senior team member for the first 90 days.

title: Code Review Standards
content: All pull requests require at least two approvals before merging. Reviews should be completed within 24 hours of submission. Reviewers must check for security vulnerabilities, test coverage, and adherence to coding standards. Automated CI checks must pass before manual review.

title: Incident Response Process
content: Incidents are classified into four severity levels: SEV1 (critical, full outage), SEV2 (major, partial outage), SEV3 (minor, degraded performance), SEV4 (low, cosmetic issues). SEV1 requires immediate response and an incident commander. All incidents require a post-mortem within 5 business days.

title: Data Retention Policy
content: Customer data is retained for 7 years after the last interaction. Personal data deletion requests under GDPR must be processed within 30 days. Backup data is retained for 90 days in cold storage. Logs are retained for 1 year and then automatically purged.

title: Performance Review Cycle
content: Performance reviews are conducted bi-annually in June and December. Self-assessments are due two weeks before the review meeting. Managers must provide written feedback with specific examples. Compensation adjustments are determined during the December review cycle.

title: Security Access Control
content: Access to production systems requires VPN and multi-factor authentication. SSH keys must be rotated every 90 days. Service accounts must use short-lived tokens with a maximum TTL of 1 hour. Access reviews are conducted quarterly by the security team.

title: API Rate Limiting
content: The public API enforces a rate limit of 100 requests per minute per API key. Authenticated users get 1000 requests per minute. Rate limit headers (X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset) are included in every response. Exceeding the limit returns HTTP 429 Too Many Requests.

title: Database Backup Strategy
content: PostgreSQL databases are backed up using continuous WAL archiving to S3. Full base backups run daily at 02:00 UTC. Point-in-time recovery is supported for the last 30 days. Backup integrity is verified weekly with automated restore tests.

title: Deployment Process
content: Deployments follow a blue-green strategy with automatic rollback on health check failure. Staging deployment is triggered automatically on merge to develop. Production deployment requires manual approval in the CI pipeline. Canary releases are used for high-risk changes affecting more than 20% of traffic.

title: Benefits Overview
content: The company provides health insurance covering medical, dental, and vision. A 401(k) plan is available with 4% employer matching. Employees receive a $1500 annual learning and development stipend. Gym membership reimbursement up to $75 per month is included.

title: Monitoring and Alerting
content: Application metrics are collected via Prometheus and visualized in Grafana. Alerts are routed through PagerDuty with escalation policies. Critical alerts trigger within 1 minute of threshold breach. The on-call rotation follows a weekly schedule with primary and secondary responders.

title: Git Branching Strategy
content: The project uses trunk-based development with short-lived feature branches. Feature branches must be prefixed with feat/, fix/, or chore/. Branches older than 7 days without activity are automatically flagged for cleanup. Direct pushes to main are blocked; all changes go through pull requests.
